accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 10 years old are open for research, unless otherwise noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists primarily of office files, program files and administrative records.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in collections by file type or originating officer. Additional finding aids are created as records are processed and open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Program Related Investments (PRIs) are loans, loan guarantees, or equity investments that allow foundations to invest in various fields with funding that is recoverable and can help expand a foundation's philanthropic resources. In 1968, Louis Winnick, Director of National Affairs suggested the Ford Foundation implement Program Related Investments. The Foundation dedicated staff and a division focused on program related investments from 1979-1995. By 1995, the Foundation was providing an average of $15 million in PRIs each year.
